trans-unit.source: Reset link timeouts must be an integer greater than 0 and less than 10000
trans-unit.target: Reset link timeouts must be an integer greater than 0 and less than 10000

trans-unit.source: Administrator reset link timeouts must be an integer greater than 0 and less than 10000.
trans-unit.target: Administrator reset link timeouts must be an integer greater than 0 and less than 10000.

trans-unit.source: Number of passwords to store must be an integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than 10000.
trans-unit.target: Number of passwords to store must be an integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than 10000.

trans-unit.source: Auto account unlock duration must be an integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than 1000.
trans-unit.target: Auto account unlock duration must be an integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than 1000.

trans-unit.source: Time before timeout must be an integer greater than or equal to 90 and less than 10000.
trans-unit.target: Time before timeout must be an integer greater than or equal to 90 and less than 10000.

trans-unit.source: Password expiry must be an integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than 10000.
trans-unit.target: Password expiry must be an integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than 10000.

trans-unit.source: Password expiry reminder must be an integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than 10000.
trans-unit.target: Password expiry reminder must be an integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than 10000.

trans-unit.source: User Registration
trans-unit.target: User Registration

trans-unit.source: Select the type of user registration, if any, allowed for this site. Private registration requires users to be authorized by the Site Administrator before gaining access to the Registered Users role. Public registration provides immediate access and Verified registration requires verification of the email address provided.
trans-unit.target: Select the type of user registration, if any, allowed for this site. Private registration requires users to be authorized by the Site Administrator before gaining access to the Registered Users role. Public registration provides immediate access and Verified registration requires verification of the email address provided.

trans-unit.source: The "Email" field, at minimum, must be included.
trans-unit.target: The "Email" field, at minimum, must be included.

trans-unit.source: You have selected the Require Unique Display Name option but you have not included the Display Name in the list of fields.
trans-unit.target: You have selected the Require Unique Display Name option but you have not included the Display Name in the list of fields.

trans-unit.source: The user base of this site contains duplicate email addresses. If you want to use email addresses as user names you must fix those entries first.
trans-unit.target: The user base of this site contains duplicate email addresses. If you want to use email addresses as user names you must fix those entries first.

trans-unit.source: Select the type of Registration Form that you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Select the type of Registration Form that you want to use.

trans-unit.target: Registration Form Type

trans-unit.source: Optionally specify a format for display names. The format can include tokens for dynamic substitution such as [FIRSTNAME] [LASTNAME]. If a display name format is specified, the display name will no longer be editable through the user interface.
trans-unit.target: Optionally specify a format for display names. The format can include tokens for dynamic substitution such as [FIRSTNAME] [LASTNAME]. If a display name format is specified, the display name will no longer be editable through the user interface.

trans-unit.source: Display Name Format
trans-unit.target: Display Name Format

trans-unit.source: Add your own Validation Expression, which is used to check the validity of the user name provided. If you change this from the default you should update the message that a user would see when they enter an invalid user name using the localization editor. (SharedResources.resx - Username.RegExError)
trans-unit.target: Add your own Validation Expression, which is used to check the validity of the user name provided. If you change this from the default you should update the message that a user would see when they enter an invalid user name using the localization editor. (SharedResources.resx - Username.RegExError)

trans-unit.target: Password Retrieval Enabled

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether or not a user can request their password to be reset. This can only be changed in web.config file.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether or not a user can request their password to be reset. This can only be changed in web.config file.

trans-unit.target: Password Reset Enabled

trans-unit.source: Specifies the minimum number of special characters in the password. This can only be changed in web.config file.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the minimum number of special characters in the password. This can only be changed in web.config file.

trans-unit.source: Min Non Alphanumeric Characters
trans-unit.target: Min Non Alphanumeric Characters

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether a question and answer system is used as part of the registration process. Can only be changed in web.config file.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether a question and answer system is used as part of the registration process. Can only be changed in web.config file.

trans-unit.source: Requires Question and Answer
trans-unit.target: Requires Question and Answer

trans-unit.source: The regular expression used to evaluate password complexity from the provider specified in the Provider property. This can only be changed in web.config file by adding/altering the passwordStrengthRegularExpression node of AspNetSqlMembershipProvider. Note: this server validation is different from the password strength meter introduced in 7.1.0 which only advises on password strength, whereas this expression is a requirement for new passwords (if it is defined).
trans-unit.target: The regular expression used to evaluate password complexity from the provider specified in the Provider property. This can only be changed in web.config file by adding/altering the passwordStrengthRegularExpression node of AspNetSqlMembershipProvider. Note: this server validation is different from the password strength meter introduced in 7.1.0 which only advises on password strength, whereas this expression is a requirement for new passwords (if it is defined).

trans-unit.source: Password Strength Regular Expression
trans-unit.target: Password Strength Regular Expression

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of times the wrong password can be entered before account is locked. This can only be changed in web.config file.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of times the wrong password can be entered before account is locked. This can only be changed in web.config file.

trans-unit.source: Max Invalid Password Attempts
trans-unit.target: Max Invalid Password Attempts

trans-unit.source: Specifies the length of time an account is locked after failed login attempts. Can only be changed in web.config file.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the length of time an account is locked after failed login attempts. Can only be changed in web.config file.

trans-unit.source: You can specify the list of fields you want to include as a comma-delimited list. If this setting is used, this will take precedence over the other settings. The possible fields include user name, email, password, confirm password, display name and all the Profile Properties.
trans-unit.target: You can specify the list of fields you want to include as a comma-delimited list. If this setting is used, this will take precedence over the other settings. The possible fields include user name, email, password, confirm password, display name and all the Profile Properties.

trans-unit.target: This is a global settings Tab. Changes to the settings will affect all of your sites.

trans-unit.target: Check the box if unsecure pages will not be accessible with SSL (HTTPS).

trans-unit.source: SSL URL
trans-unit.target: SSL URL

trans-unit.source: Optionally specify a URL which will be used for secure connections for this site. This is only necessary if you do not have an SSL Certificate installed for your standard site URL. An example would be a shared hosting account where the host provides you with a Shared SSL URL.
trans-unit.target: Optionally specify a URL which will be used for secure connections for this site. This is only necessary if you do not have an SSL Certificate installed for your standard site URL. An example would be a shared hosting account where the host provides you with a Shared SSL URL.

trans-unit.source: Standard URL
trans-unit.target: Standard URL

trans-unit.source: If an SSL URL is specified above, then specify the Standard URL for unsecure connections.
trans-unit.target: If an SSL URL is specified above, then specify the Standard URL for unsecure connections.

trans-unit.source: This setting determines if error messages sent via the error querystring parameter should be shown inline in the page.
trans-unit.target: This setting determines if error messages sent via the error querystring parameter should be shown inline in the page.

trans-unit.source: Show Critical Errors on Screen
trans-unit.target: Show Critical Errors on Screen

trans-unit.source: Check this box to run the installation in "debug mode". This causes various parts of the application to write more verbose error logs etc. Note: This may lead to performance degradation.
trans-unit.target: Check this box to run the installation in "debug mode". This causes various parts of the application to write more verbose error logs etc. Note: This may lead to performance degradation.

trans-unit.target: Enable Remember Me on Login Control

trans-unit.source: Check this box to display the Remember Login check box on the login control that allows users to stay logged in for multiple visits.
trans-unit.target: Check this box to display the Remember Login check box on the login control that allows users to stay logged in for multiple visits.

trans-unit.source: Auto-Unlock Accounts After (Minutes)
trans-unit.target: Auto-Unlock Accounts After (Minutes)

trans-unit.source: After an account is locked out due to unsuccessful login attempts, it can be automatically unlocked with a successful authentication after a certain period of time has elapsed. Enter the number of minutes to wait until the account can be automatically unlocked. Enter "0" to disable the auto-unlock feature.
trans-unit.target: After an account is locked out due to unsuccessful login attempts, it can be automatically unlocked with a successful authentication after a certain period of time has elapsed. Enter the number of minutes to wait until the account can be automatically unlocked. Enter "0" to disable the auto-unlock feature.

trans-unit.source: Set a value that indicates the time, in seconds, before asynchronous postbacks time out if no response is received, the value should between 90-9999 seconds.
trans-unit.target: Set a value that indicates the time, in seconds, before asynchronous postbacks time out if no response is received, the value should between 90-9999 seconds.

trans-unit.source: The field is richtext. Spammers may put links to their website in their biography field.
trans-unit.target: The field is richtext. Spammers may put links to their website in their biography field.

trans-unit.source: The biography field is a common target for spammers as they can add links/html to it. In DNN 7.2.0 this was changed to a multiline textbox which removes this risk.
trans-unit.target: The biography field is a common target for spammers as they can add links/html to it. In DNN 7.2.0 this was changed to a multiline textbox which removes this risk.

trans-unit.source: We have found 1 or more superuser accounts that have not been logged in or had activity in six months. Consider deleting them as a best practice
trans-unit.target: We have found 1 or more superuser accounts that have not been logged in or had activity in six months. Consider deleting them as a best practice

trans-unit.source: Superuser accounts are the most powerful DNN accounts. As a best practice these should be limited.
trans-unit.target: Superuser accounts are the most powerful DNN accounts. As a best practice these should be limited.

trans-unit.source: At least one superuser account has a password that has not been changed in more than 6 months.
trans-unit.target: At least one superuser account has a password that has not been changed in more than 6 months.

trans-unit.source: A view-state MAC is an encrypted version of the hidden variable that a page's view state is persisted to when the page is sent to the browser. When this property is set to true, the encrypted view state is checked to verify that it has not been tampered with on the client.
trans-unit.target: A view-state MAC is an encrypted version of the hidden variable that a page's view state is persisted to when the page is sent to the browser. When this property is set to true, the encrypted view state is checked to verify that it has not been tampered with on the client.

trans-unit.source: The viewstate is protected via the usage of a MAC

trans-unit.target: Check if default.aspx or default.aspx.cs files have been modified

trans-unit.source: The default page(s) have been modified. We recommend you evaluate these files carefully, they may be modified by a hacker and may contain malicious code. It is best to compare these files with that from a standard install of your product. Ensure that the DNN or Evoq version of your current site matches with the standard site prior to comparison. Either remove the malicious code or restore these files from standard installation.
trans-unit.target: The default page(s) have been modified. We recommend you evaluate these files carefully, they may be modified by a hacker and may contain malicious code. It is best to compare these files with that from a standard install of your product. Ensure that the DNN or Evoq version of your current site matches with the standard site prior to comparison. Either remove the malicious code or restore these files from standard installation.

trans-unit.target: DNN use default.aspx to load everything, so all requests will load this file when user browse the site, if someone modify this file, it may cause huge risk.

trans-unit.source: Current SQL Server account can read registry values. You need to check the permissions of xp_regread, xp_regwrite, xp_regenumkeys, xp_regenumvalues, xp_regdeletekey, xp_regdeletekey, xp_regdeletevalue, xp_instance_regread, xp_instance_regwrite, xp_instance_regenumkeys, xp_instance_regenumvalues, xp_instance_regdeletekey, xp_instance_regdeletekey, xp_instance_regdeletevalue stored procedures.
trans-unit.target: Current SQL Server account can read registry values.
